title: Call of Juarez: The Cartel
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Truly this game is a disappointment on nearly every level.

title: Dead Horde
review: You cant come up with an idea for an interesting varied gameplay your budget is very limited and your breathtaking script is being digested by a dog? Dont worry – just make another mediocre zombie game and publish it on Steam. Someone will buy it. [September 2011 p.73]

title: Mr. Driller Online
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | General | Puzzle | General
review: Take the thing online (that is the name of the game after all...) and the results are truly beyond atrocious. [Issue#33 p.116]

title: Infinity Runner
review: Infinity Runner is a failure from every point of view. Born as a PC game and also available on PS4 it hasnt definitely found its place in the market.

title: Grooverider Slot Car Thunder
review: Slot car racing is bloody boring enough without have to replicate it in a videogame. Whats next? Snail racing?... It stinks.

title: Generation Zero
review: If you’re the sort of person who enjoys aimless wandering but doesn’t like the idea of getting up off the couch and actually doing it then you might be in luck here. Otherwise don’t bother because it’s absolutely not worth it.

title: Hard Truck: Apocalypse
genres: Simulation | Driving | Car Combat | Car Combat | Vehicle | Combat
review: Nuclear holocaust survivors in a post-apocalyptic world filled with people wearing clown masks may find Hard Truck: Apocalypse to be an effective training tool but anyone looking for a good game should look elsewhere.

title: Hard Rock Casino
review: Realistic? Yes. Fun? Not one bit. Whats worse is that you have to sit and listen to the other fake players talk smack at the tables with the same four lines of speech. Youll be wise to quickly run to the Options menu and turn the sound off.

title: Hyperdimension Neptunia
review: Theres precious little to recommend here outside of the occasionally cutesy over-sexed anime visuals and comedy wobbling breasts.

title: Bravo Team
review: As a demo it actually works; when I played it for ten minutes in a controlled environment last year I came away quite impressed with it. But those first ten minutes are Bravo Teams limit and Sony should have realised this and pulled the plug on the project as a commercial game a long time ago.

title: Rodea the Sky Soldier
review: If you are a huge fan of NiGHTS it’s worth picking up at a discounted price because there is some fun to be had here: just the fun moments are few and far between.

title: Smart Bomb
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | General | Puzzle | General
review: My advice to the developers is next time skip the shaking the timers and the laughable cinemas and spend more time polishing and testing. [June 2005 p.101]

title: Catwoman
review: This game certainly has some really great graphics and animations but it comes up short on being able to keep things moving at an enjoyable pace not to mention that its very difficult to control.

title: Earthworm Jim 2
review: Doesnt anyone anywhere give a rats ass about this franchise anymore? [Aug 2002 p.76]

title: Shadow the Hedgehog
review: For all the consternation about a gun-toting enigma invading a kid-friendly video-game series the only thing to fear in Segas Shadow the Hedgehog is the games slap-dash excution. [Mar 2006 p.80]

title: Crash: Mind Over Mutant
review: Crash: Mind Over Mutant is a competent platformer. While it leaves much to be desired in terms of depth and level design fans of the titular Bandicoot or starved DS platform lovers may enjoy it. Others should pass this one by.

title: Battlestar Galactica
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: This cheap tacky space combat sim is a stinking mess insulting the name of the series merely by presuming to associate itself with it. [Mar 2008 p.83]

title: Rodea the Sky Soldier
review: Rodea the Sky Soldier is simply a game that really needed more time and a course correction. A lot of promising concepts are seen and experienced throughout but the flying and Sonic homing-style combat would have been executed so much better with a bit more polish.

title: Warriors: Legends of Troy
review: It may be surprisingly faithful to the original transcripts even if it gives very little information regarding the Trojan War but that is the only positive aspect of this new western oriented button masher from Koei. This recreation of Homers Epic is extremely shallow and repetitive offering nothing new to the genre.

title: Ford Bold Moves Street Racing
review: But its worthless and Eidos knows it. The game design is so transparent the goal behind the game is so obvious the lack of any morsel of fun is so far from the car and tracks and the playing of it…its just exasperating. This is pure bargain bin trash.

title: Darkest of Days
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: While the story had potential for creating a cool juncture between history and science fiction there’s very little flexing of those muscles in the actual product.

title: The Scourge Project: Episodes 1 and 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Plays unbearably clumsily. [June 2010 p.104]

title: Sword of the Stars II: Lords of Winter
review: Bottom line is that on paper this is an incredibly deep and varied game but time and again the reach of the programmers vastly exceeds their grasp. Even months after release theres so little in this game thats working as intended that only the most desperate die-hard fan of the genre should even consider this game.

title: Zoo Tycoon DS
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: The tiny blocky graphics do little to immerse you into the park and the unwieldy controls make relatively simple actions needlessly difficult.

title: Watchmen: The End Is Nigh Part 2
review: Second-rate action game is boring for comic devotees and too easy for fighting game fans. Voice cast from the original movie actors can not change anything of this. [Oct 2009]

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutants in Manhattan
review: The end result is a cluttered mess that constantly tries to keep you active with something anything at random in order to distract you from the poor design.

title: Dinotopia: The Sunstone Odyssey
review: The gameplay is lackluster the musical track is enough to make you fall asleep and the voice acting is so bad that you can’t help but weep.

title: Superman: The Man of Steel
review: Its not as mind-blowingly awful as the old N64 Superman stinker but it is outclassed by nearly every other comic-book game out there. [Feb 2003 p.154]

title: ESPN National Hockey Night
review: National Hockey Nights graphics are solid but its no-frills gameplay modes and abysmal control leech the fun from the game leaving a superficial shell behind.

title: Watchmen: The End Is Nigh Part 2
review: As a stand-alone download its a short rendition of the Watchmen brawler experience that features more low points than high points -- but with an admittedly awesome moment of Rorschach punching a fat pervert.

title: Hummer Badlands
review: If you like racing games play Forza Burnout or Gran Turismo. If you are someone who likes Hummer vehicles go and play Mercenaries to see how it should handle.

title: TMNT: Mutant Melee
review: Its hard to find the fun in Mutant Melee whether playing alone or with friends. [May 2005 p.54]

title: Last Rebellion
genres: Role-Playing | Action RPG | Console-style RPG | Console-style RPG | Japanese-Style
review: Although the combat system is unique the progressively easy difficulty atrocious story and subpar visuals make Last Rebellion difficult to recommend. Its also incredibly short requiring less than fifteen hours to complete the game.

title: Chronovolt
review: Chronovolt is a glitchy and unsatisfying title thats hard to recommend. While you may glean some enjoyment from its opening moments the novelty swiftly wears thin. This title is best rolled out of sight and into obscurity.

title: Dead Island: Ryder White
review: However Mr. Whites wild ride isnt the only thing included in this package – there are also a few new schematics for making new weapons. These can be accessed in the regular game as well as the DLC. This is a cool feature if youre new to Dead Island or are on a new playthrough but theres not really enough there to warrant paying for the DLC. Dead Island is still a game that deserves to be played if you missed it last year – but Ryder White can be safely skipped.

title: The Mummy Returns
review: Talking of light there are several periods playing as Rick that youll be inching forward down rocky tunnels with virtually no illumination to help you and the 3D map that you can cut to when youre feeling lost is worse than useless.

title: State of Emergency 2
review: Flaws like this keep State of Emergency 2 from being anything more than a straightforward third-person shooting gallery. [Jun 2006 p.92]

title: AeternoBlade II
review: With unenjoyable and clunky combat that is made much worse during the 3D segments a laughably archetypal fantasy story and dated character models it’s hard to actually believe that AeternoBlade II released this year for modern consoles. AeternoBlade II simply falls short of all of its ambitions whatever they might have been.

title: Fimbul
review: The end result is that Fimbul is a soulless experience that never amounts to much more than something that will forever represent the developer’s unrealized vision. Throwing the unpredictable bugs glitches and wayward problems that are present on Nintendo Switch into consideration it’s hard to not come to the conclusion that you’d be better off simply leaving it to someone else to prevent Ragnarök from happening.

title: Golden Axe: Beast Rider
review: A game destined for the chopping block. [Summer 2009 p.78]

title: MotoGP 08
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | Motorcycle | Automobile | Street | Street
review: MotoGP is one of the most popular titles in the driving panorama however this Wii version hasnt been as lucky as the ones in PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. This is a lackluster product which could have hit the billboards.

title: Hard Rock Casino
review: Quantity over quality this suite of gambling games fails to capture the thrill of throwing all your money away on the single spin of a wheel.

title: Bubsy: The Woolies Strike Back
review: It doesnt feel like much love went into this project in almost every aspect. Its probably the best game in the Bubsy franchise (not saying much) but also lacks some of the few things that really gave Bubsy any definition at all. It just feels like a random platformer with Bubsy plastered all over it because hey remember him? Oh also its thirty dollars. In a year that has brought us a bevvy of amazing platformers some even revitalizing long-dormant series Bubsy is easily left behind.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Theres no exclusive content just a new way to struggle with already poor combat.

title: Swashbucklers: Blue vs. Grey
review: An inferior copy of a classic Swashbucklers isnt worth your time.

title: Discs of Tron
review: A minor distraction perhaps but classic is reserved for titles that carry fond memories and are still as satisfying to play as they ever were and Discs of Tron just doesn’t fit that description at all.

title: Splat Renegade Paintball
review: Not only is this game absolutely atrocious but you generally dont want to give a machine a reason to hate you.

title: Big Mutha Truckers 2
genres: Driving | Racing | Mission-based | Arcade | Mission-based | Automobile
review: Foist this game on a hated enemy; its surprising a bomb this big doesnt come ticking. [Oct 2005 p.70]

title: Warriors Orochi 2
review: Personally I get a similar amount of pleasure from cleaning the oven or mowing the lawn both of which I can do for free and both of which provide some tangible benefit when Im done rather than just making my thumbs hurt.

title: Big Beach Sports
review: What a stinker. [Aug 2008 p.101]

title: The Sacred Rings
review: The limited gameplay with an atmosphere that is completely spoiled by some deviously frustrating design and lazy pathing leads to an experience that for most will be flat and lifeless.

title: Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark
review: There is no question Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark plays and feels like your typical movie tie-in game. Everything about it screams ‘rushed out the door’ to satisfy the needs of all those poor suckers who wasted money watching the big screen stinker.

title: Tetris Worlds
review: If youre looking for a rewarding block-dropping experience however save yourself the thirty-five bucks and pick up a portable version. Chances are itll be cheaper more fun and less inclined to promote suicidal megalomania.

title: NFL QB Club 2001
review: Its a damned shame but theres just about no good reason to bring this game into your life.

title: Q*bert: Rebooted
review: Not being able to reliably move in diagonal directions makes certain levels near impossible. Q*Bert deserves better.

title: Risen 3: Titan Lords
review: The characters filling out the world are frankly insultingly stupid and voiced so badly it wouldnt have even been funny in the 90s.[Nov 2014 p.79]

title: Army Men: Sarge's War
review: The gameplay is horribly repetitive and dull the controls are twitchy the visuals are bland and the audio is laughable.

title: Pac-Man World 3
review: Suffers from one of the worst cameras in recent memory killer slowdown and bland levels rife with invisible barriers. [Feb 2006 p.97]

title: Combat of Giants: Dinosaurs 3D
review: Tyranna-bore-us Rex. Triceraplops.Velocicraptor. You get the picture.

title: Husk
review: HUSK is full of technical issues and bugs that affect the progress of the story. Great setting but very poor execution. Unplayable.

title: Naughty Bear: Panic in Paradise
review: Its only arguably redeeming quality is the way it caters to the same kind of morbid fascination that drives kids to rip the wings off of butterflies or have catered Justin Bieber parties. And if theres any justice in this industry at all that one strength will not be enough to save this dreck from the bowels of the bargain bin.

title: Johnny Kung Fu
review: If a product wants to bring our memories back to when videogames were just lines and beeps it must offer something to still keep us entertained in 2012. Johnny Kung Fu just doesnt have what it takes. There are a way better options for that price in the e-shop. Dont waste your time with this.

title: FunTown Mahjong
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | Puzzle | Matching | Board / Card Game | Matching
review: Mahjong has been strangely missing from the XBLA. Unfortunately FunTown Mahjong is simply not good enough to fill that niche. Its sloppy presentation is its ultimate downfall from the terrible tutorial to the awful audio-visual.

title: Crash Time: Autobahn Pursuit
review: Frustrating cheap and lacking any real depth. A modern Chase HQ this isnt. [Aug 2008 p.80]

title: Godzilla: Unleashed
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Sci-Fi | Fighting | General | 3D
review: Unleashed isnt completely without merit -- it just falls far below any reasonable standard for fighting wrestling or monster games.

title: Beowulf: The Game
review: Ubisoft Shanghai and Tiwak did a magnificent job of butchering the reimagining of a classic tale and providing plenty of disposable derivative gameplay to go along with it.

title: NeverEnd (2006)
genres: Role-Playing | Console-style RPG | Console-style RPG | Japanese-Style
review: Unless youre looking for some laughs or a trip down memory lane stay far far away from this one.

title: Jonny Moseley Mad Trix
review: Your magnetic skis do more than just hug the rails when you’re grinding along – they magically suck you toward rails if you’re in the vicinity. It’s ridiculous. [Mar 2002 p.108]

title: Street Trace: NYC
genres: Simulation | Driving | Car Combat | Car Combat | Vehicle | Combat
review: There is a place for more substantial 3D games like this on the platform but Street Trace: NYC provides nothing to recommend itself over the slew of more tightly focussed and expressed rivals on the platform.

title: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Advanced Warfighter
review: Tom Clancys Ghost Recon Advanced Warfighter is a very bad game on the PlayStation 2. Its terrible from a technical standpoint and nothing else about its design really brings it out of the gutter.

title: Harmonix Music VR
review: There’s little value and almost no substance in Harmonix Music VR. Its drab modes and environments fail to add anything interesting to the music listening experience.

title: Cops 2170: The Power of Law
review: There’s no tutorial to ease you into the game the manual is overly cryptic there’s no adjustable difficulty level and combat seems almost intentionally tedious.

title: C.O.R.E.
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: This archaic first-person shooter is lousy to its core.

title: Oddworld: Munch's Oddysee
review: The developers should have just stuck with the tried-and-true 2D Prince of Persia-style of the previous Oddworld games for this conversion. Munchs Oddysee is full of little quirks that add up to a very un-fun GBA game that cant even fall back on technical merits.

title: Dragonriders: Chronicles of Pern
review: A bad adventure game based on far better books. Go read them.

title: Iron Man
review: A by-the-numbers affair unlikely to rouse most action fans. Maybe you wont toss your controller in a fit of rage (unlike the frustrating PS3/360 games) but with gameplay and presentation this uninteresting do you even need pick it up to begin with?

title: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Falsebound Kingdom
review: The Falsebound Kingdom is almost a prophetic title as this inferior product is forced upon the multitude of loyal supporters that are blind to the deception and exploitation employed by the Yu-Gi-Oh Empire.

title: Mike Tyson Boxing
review: Gruesome and indescribably disappointing.

title: Mike Tyson Boxing
review: There’s no ear biting in Tyson’s animated repertoire (damn!) but there’re plenty of other ways to rearrange your opponent’s face—even though you won’t recognize any of them.

title: TotemBall
review: If youre not gnashing your teeth trying to make Totem Ball work then youre gritting them in pain because your arms are killing you. [Holiday 2006 p.80]

title: Hellboy: The Science of Evil
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Beat-'Em-Up | Beat-'Em-Up | Linear
review: That its online component is limited to a linear and moderately laggy co-op mode - and therefore feels even more ponderous than the single-player game - does little to spirit this comic book tie-in from gaming purgatory. [July 2008 p.80]

title: Vaccine
review: The idea of implementing roguelike elements and endless game design in old-school survival horror has potential but Vaccine fails to capitalise on it. Aspects where the developers could have improved on were perks that could allow a 180-degree turn a map system or even a combo system where it can be possible to earn back extra time like Resident Evils The Mercenaries mode. With much more variety in level design and more enemies Vaccine could have been an interesting guilty pleasure. In its current state this seems more like pre-alpha build with many of the features not yet implemented.

title: Cortex Command
genres: Action | Strategy | Real-Time | Platformer | Platformer | 2D | 2D | Command
review: Occasionally entertaining but plagued by AI bugs and hamstrung by a clunky user interface. Less than the sum of its parts.

title: NPPL Championship Paintball 2009
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Essentially the only thing that kept us playing the campaign mode was to escape the horrible rap metal in the menu screens. [Mar 2009 p.83]

title: Iron Man
review: If Iron Man Wii looked better and played smoother it would at least be bearable. But it doesnt and it isnt. [Issue#23 p.62]

title: Black Stone: Magic & Steel
review: Seems to have sprung up from the sharp minds of bored high school students who probably spent too much time playing Gauntlet. [Winter 2002 p.109]

title: Ridge Racer
review: Few tracks few cars little fun. Ridge Racer is an ugly demo sold at thirty euro with the amazing idea of expanding the game content through DLC.

title: Battleship
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Shooter | Board Games | Shooter | Board Games | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Tactical
review: Theres an element of novelty in the first few minutes of play but it doesnt last long. It isnt even the sketchy gameplay that sinks this Battleship – its the abhorrently commercial objective apparent in every second of rushed gameplay. Theres no artistic vision here and the original idea at its core hasnt been given the time and love needed to build a coherent or enjoyable game.

title: SunAge
review: Well and truly eclipsed by the passage of RTS history. [Feb 2008 p.79]

title: Submersed
review: Submersed takes an interesting and original premise and does virtually nothing good with it. There are elements and ideas of a good game in the bare bones of this but it is all so poorly executed and dull that it is difficult to recommend. The fact that it is a mid-price game on PS4 only compounds this amateur feel as there are hundreds of similar games available on Steam for a couple of quid. In the end this is far more snores than Jaws and lacks any real bite.

title: Mindjack
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Modern | Arcade
review: A complete waste of good ideas. Theres really no reason why you should bother buying this mess.

title: Infinity Runner
review: Any Temple Run player will be familiar with the basic premise and Infinity Runner does little to shake things up – instead delivering trial-and-error gameplay dodgy production values and repeated.

title: Tony Hawk Ride
genres: Sports | Alternative | Individual | Skateboarding | Skateboarding | Skate / Skateboard
review: But sadly Ride simply lacks the same quality providing and unimaginative playing experience that never seems to get out of the blocks and you may feel you’ve being taken for a ride with this game especially considering its price!

title: Combat: Task Force 121
review: From the lackluster graphics to the terrible enemy AI the crappy single-player and the generic online play this game doesnt offer anything you havent seen before.

title: Empire of Magic
review: Its poorly designed poorly executed and downright frustrating to play.

title: Evolution Skateboarding
review: Compared to the numerous improvements and mini-games in the incredibly playable Tony Hawks Pro Skater 4 Evolution Skateboarding feels as if it were already on the brink of extinction.

title: Salt Lake 2002
genres: Sports | Olympic Sports | Olympic Sports | Individual | Athletics
review: After just a half-hour SLC 2002 will be straight in the trash. Its a mathematical certainty. [May 2002 p.77]

title: Calvino Noir
review: An excellent noir aesthetic doesnt save Calvino Noir from its utterly incompetent and buggy gameplay making for an infuriating stealth title.

title: Tornado
review: Tornado is a title that started with a solid base of fun gameplay mechanics and interesting level design and then buried it under a mound of inexplicably terrible design faults that seem like they were created to generate annoyance.

title: Gothic 3: Forsaken Gods
genres: Role-Playing | PC-style RPG | PC-style RPG | Western-Style
review: Forsaken gods? Rather forsaken legacy and a blatant ripoff. After two years of development we receive a game with a plethora of bugs jerky graphics and frequent crashes to the desktop a game that strips this franchise of the pitiful remains of its former glory. [Jan 2009]

title: MilitAnt
review: There is very little fun to be had in MilitAnt. After spending most of my time breezing through half of the game’s bosses all but submitting to the other half (with a pair of very green exceptions) and rushing past nearly every basic enemy I get the impression that this ubiquitous imbalance in difficulty is more likely a vast oversight than a design choice.

title: Pirates vs Ninjas Dodgeball
review: Ultimately Pirates Vs. Ninja Dodgeball is a waste of time.

title: Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Wrath of the Darkhul King
review: Un-challenging un-fun easy to beat and way too short. It’s such a boring game that the only saving grace is that it’s mercifully short.

title: Metal Dungeon
review: This game is more of an action adventure without the combat. Its also a little shy on action and adventure.

title: Jurassic Park III: The DNA Factor
review: A smidgen of intellect surrounded by garbage does not make for a good game.

title: Bombshell (2016)
review: Bombshell could have been a fine six-hour shooter but the unfulfilling fetch quests uninspired firearms and meddling glitches stretch the story until – like the game’s suicidal aliens – you too beg for death.

title: Enemy Front
genres: Shooter | Historic | Action | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Historic
review: A disappointing return to WWII with sub-par artificial intelligence limited multiplayer support and several annoying bugs.

title: Terminator Salvation
review: As a movie game goes it could have been pretty decent if there was a larger variety of enemies and of course the game was about 4 times the length. As is we have another movie licensed game that fails to deliver the goods.

title: Turning Point: Fall of Liberty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: If Churchill had died we might all be speaking German but at least we wouldnt have to put up with nonsense like this.

title: Star Trek The Video Game
review: Its numerous bugs and linear missions make it frustrating to play and the story never grabs you like a good sci-fi adventure should. Even the most devoted of Star Trek fans will be hard pressed to find something to like in Star Trek The Video Game: there are simply too many glaring problems.

title: Danger Girl
review: Big breasts can go a long way to brightening up any day but with gameplay this dim even these headlights cant light up this game.

title: Word Puzzle
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | General | Logic | General
review: See as the puzzles get bigger youre actually forced to scroll them onto the screen which will slow you down even more. Save your $10 for something more worthwhile. This isnt even a decent time-waster.

title: Devil's Third
genres: Action Adventure | General | Modern | Action | Shooter | Third-Person | Arcade
review: With just five hours on the counter barely anything gets time to truly sink in. Add to this the technical issues and the inconsistencies of the presentation and you have a game that could have benefited from a bit more playtesting.

title: Everreach: Project Eden
review: This game fails at almost everything it sets out to do. With janky animations embarrassing story awful combat mechanics and horrible enemy layouts and AI theres just not much positive to say about it.

title: Blood Knights
genres: Role-Playing | Action Adventure | Fantasy | General | Fantasy | Action RPG
review: It’s an awkward mix of Diablo and Soul Reaver that nobody asked for. Something to play if you’ve got a few hours and an itch to bump up your Gamerscore.

title: Digimon World Data Squad
review: The game offers nothing but tedium to older gamers but the six and under crowd may love it. [Nov 2007 p.90]

title: Six Flags Fun Park
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | General | Party | Party / Minigame
review: If you have a kid and are already planning a trip to Six Flags this is a solid pick-up as this $25 game has a $30 kids admission voucher in it (if you go before the end of 2009) so its basically like getting the game for free. Just be prepared to hear complaints from a soon-to-be bored child a few days after purchase.

title: Monster Jam
genres: Driving | Racing | Simulation | Truck | Truck | Automobile
review: A game without a reason to live consigned to the scrapheap by the 360s real racers. [July 2008 p.83]

title: Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime
genres: Action Adventure | Modern | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | General
review: Recycled environments mediocre gameplay and the absence of online play cripple this disappointing top-down adventure.

title: Power Rangers Super Megaforce
review: Skip this game and keep your fingers crossed that the next one will be better.

title: Quantum Theory
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Quantum Theory is the epitome of awful game design. Uninspired. Underdeveloped. Gray. Some of the worst story telling this generation has seen coupled with some of the worst visuals youll find on your beautiful PS3 or Xbox 360 in addition to level design thatll bore you the minute you lay your eyes on it.

title: John Deere: Harvest in the Heartland
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: Even if John Deere: Harvest in the Heartland worked perfectly it would be an uninspired unattractive game that beats the player over the head with its sponsor.

title: New Rally-X
review: Just be prepared for a game that screams I’m simple (as in I’m mediocre not I’m elegantly designed).

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: If you like Harry Potter - dont buy this game. If you like TPP shooters - stay away from this game. If you like good music - buy yourself the official movie soundtrack. If youre the parents of a young teenager - choose anything but this game. Youll hurt your child with it. Dont buy this game because you are voting with your wallet. By paying for this game you allow more of THAT to be developed in the future.

title: FIFA 20: Legacy Edition
review: If you’re simply looking to play Career Mode on the go then you may get some mileage out of FIFA 20 Legacy Edition on Switch but if you can buy FIFA on any other platform then we suggest you do. The Switchs FIFA legacy is fast becoming outdated gameplay and missing features and the only way to put a stop to this is to vote with your wallet.

title: Soldner: Secret Wars
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Tactical | Modern
review: This game attempts to combine the best aspects of serious tactical shooters like Flashpoint with the run-and-gun action of the Battlefield series but does neither very well. [40 = original score]

title: Spuds Unearthed
review: There’s a core gameplay loop that could have some substance but it’s surrounded by a confused interface a simply awful tutorial with surface-level complexity that needn’t exist.

title: Hatred
genres: Modern | Action | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Arcade | Top-Down
review: I have to kill everbody. It works but its a primitive piece of garbage. Its so bad its almost funny.

title: Flushed Away
review: Yet another poor incarnation of a movie (which didn’t do that great anyway) which doesn’t accomplish anything other than giving the player consistent headaches throughout. Blame it on its poor level design repetitive gameplay constant bugs or whatever you like as there are ample pickings.

title: New Gundam Breaker
review: Between fumbling through the menus mashing your way to a choppy and exceedingly easy victory and clicking through meandering dialogue scenes that hold no weight you’ll find yourself too bored to actually collect all the parts you want to make your perfect Gundam. If you’re itching to fight big robots play Gundam Versus instead. Or go punch that actual Gundam in Japan (don’t do that).

title: PDC World Championship Darts 2008
review: PDC World Championship Darts 2008 is a game that really has no reason to exist.

title: PlayStation Move Ape Escape
review: A wasted opportunity to show off Move control. [Sept 2011 p.102]

title: 1950s Lawn Mower Kids
review: The game isnt especially good and I cant recommend it. The developer successfully made a game about summer chores feel like a chore but I dont know if that was the point.

title: Final Fight: Streetwise
review: Final Fight: Streetwise doesnt look good doesnt play well and it cant even get its unlockable bonus--the original arcade game--right.

title: Zathura

title: The Elder Scrolls: Blades
review: The Elder Scrolls: Blades is a simple case of a mediocre game on mobile just not holding up on an actual console. Concessions made for mobile play just don’t make sense here. Not to mention when blown up to a TV or even the modest size of the Switch’s screen Blades is pretty ugly. Its a downright joke when compared to the actual full Elder Scrolls game already available on the platform. Unlike other Bethesda mobile offerings like Fallout Shelter Blades is a simplification of a complex game rather than a game built with mobile limitations in mind. When you take away the reason for those limitations you’re left with an ugly mess of a game with nothing to justify its own existence.

title: Contra: Rogue Corps

In the end nothing about this endeavour feels in any way related to the Contra games you know and love and you’d do much better to grab the Contra Anniversary Collection at a much lower price – or try out one of the many excellent retro twin-stick shooters or side-scrolling action games already available on the platform.

title: Nickelodeon Kart Racers

review: If you’re looking for some racing action on the go you can get a much better less frustrating experience from one of the many other street racing titles available.

title: Dragon's Lair
genres: Action | Adventure | Interactive Movie | General | Arcade | Interactive Movie
review: Dragons Lair is not the game youre looking for on Xbox Live. The controls dont work well and you dont need a lot of time to beat the entire game. So leave your sword where it is because Dragons Lair doesnt ever make you feel like a knight.

title: American Idol
review: Overall it seems like the production attitude was to quote the Simon Cowell-managed Westlife Hey whatever. A very poor cash-in and one to avoid.

title: 101-in-1 Sports Party Megamix
review: The Wii does shovelware better than anyone but its really hit a new low with 101-in-1 Sports. [Jan 2011 p.69]

title: 007 Legends
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: A clear attempt to cash in on 49 years of Bond goodwill and the gaming ignorance of many of the Christmas-present-buying public 007 Legends is a game that belongs in the previous generation but even then it would have been tough to recommend.

title: Mall Tycoon
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: Its ugly bland boring and nondescript. Kind of like the average mall.

title: Duke Nukem: Manhattan Project
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Scrolling | Shoot-'Em-Up | Sci-Fi | Horizontal
review: For its time Duke Nukem: Manhattan project was a pretty decent sidescroller. Eight years late and we have a mess of mediocrity on our hands. Stay away. Very very far away.

title: Clash of the Titans
review: A wonky also-ran.

title: 0 Day Attack on Earth
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: A game with a nice little gimmick regarding Goolge-Earth-like maps becomes just that. A dissapointingly bad game with nothing but a gimmick.

title: Iron Man 2
review: One of the worst games this year so far - a soulless movie tie-in with a broken control scheme crappy graphics repetitive missions and a terrible story. Just stay away from this heap of rusty scrap metal and go see the movie instead.

title: Dollhouse
review: A great concept does not automatically make for a great videogame especially when the execution is this lacklustre. In this case the repetitive gameplay long loading times and awful graphics are the main detractors. The intriguing multiplayer set-up couldve been a saving grace but is ultimately hampered by a severe lack of players. Shame.

title: Star Trek: Shattered Universe
review: Its just a bad game with crappy cinemas and more than enough frustrating moments to make you weep into your Romulan Ale. [Dec/Jan 2004 p.89]

title: Nickelodeon Kart Racers
review: With a disappointing selection of series and characters available a poor visual environment faulty controls and a soundtrack that would need a complete overhaul this is a passable game that will not satisfy anyone.

title: Way of the Dogg
review: Apart from its many issues it fails to entertain which the worst thing that could happen to any game.

title: 4PM
review: Imagine if David Cage were even more of a dribbling lunatic. Welcome to 4PM.

title: WWII Aces
review: Yet more proof that slapping motion controls on a lousy game doesnt magically make it worthwhile. [Mar 2008 p.87]

title: Delta Force: Xtreme 2
genres: Action | General | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Tactical | Modern | Modern
review: A general lack of polish that makes me wonder if NovaLogic even care about the games they make any more. [Dec 2009 p.74]

title: Slain!
review: Slain is what happens when naiveté and enthusiasm rampage through ability and execution. Unfortunately its the latter pair that measure proficiency leaving Slain so hostile broken and boring that its hard to muster a sympathetic response.

title: Alekhine's Gun
review: Biggest problem of AG isn’t the story or lackluster graphics but its incredibly poor AI. Should you cause an alarm every guard on the level will blindly run to that spot letting you shoot them one by one without even changing position. At some point you start to wonder – why bother trying to stealth around if it’s so much easier to just kill everyone? [Issue#209 p.63]

title: Tank Beat
genres: Action | Simulation | General | General | Vehicle | Combat
review: There is nothing in this game that represents fun. I hate to say that but when all the members of the house give it a try and no one could say anything good about it well that just seals the deal.

title: The Polar Express
review: An ugly collection of poorly conceived minigames The Polar Express is a failure by the standards of any medium.

title: Around the World in 80 Days
review: There arent any two player options and the main game is remarkably short. There isnt anything to make you want to play Around The World In 80 Days again particularly not the tedious and often frustrating gameplay.

title: Evil Dead: Hail to the King
review: The graphics are poor the gameplay boring and even Bruce Campbell can’t save the game. It’s not even worth it in the bargain-bin.

title: Naval Assault: The Killing Tide
review: A disappointment all around. Fans of the genre will scoff at the visuals and simplicity while more casual players will grow bored of its tedious missions and slow-paced gameplay.

title: The Chaos Engine (2013)
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Top-Down
review: Quotation forthcoming.

title: Space Raiders
review: The two-player mode adds no value to Space Raiders because there isn’t enough substance to the gameplay in the first place. There’s no sense of challenge and there is little fun since dodging and shooting at the same spot in a street is so undeveloped for games these days.

title: Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
review: Its a collect-a-thon thats not so big not so deep and not so tall and its also devoid of the fun thats craved by all.

title: Ducati World Racing Challenge
review: This is yet another insult to Dreamcast owners and no one should have to suffer through it. Ducati World Racing Challenge is racing at its absolute worst.

title: Ace Banana
review: Everything is just far too repetitive (not to mention tiring) to get folks through the campaign. A co-op mode didn’t even make it out in time for launch which could have at least added some reason to keep playing. Ace Banana may be technically sound but it’s plainly uninteresting when compared to the rest of PSVR’s launch lineup.

title: DRIV3R
genres: Driving | Action Adventure | Racing | Mission-based | Arcade | Mission-based | Open-World | Automobile
review: You might be more interested to know what Driv3r isn’t though – a good game.

title: Screwjumper!
review: Charging 800 points for this when the aforementioned Castlevania: SotN comes at the same price is taking the proverbial. Steer well clear of this one.

title: Made Man: Confessions of the Family Blood
review: Utterly horrendous in every conceivable aspect.

title: Chronus Arc
review: There’s nothing to actually recommend about Chronus Arc. Fans of 16-bit and earlier JRPGs won’t get the nostalgic rush they might hope for from this game because it’s so artificially put together it feels more like an insult to the memory of those games than a celebration of them.

title: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon Because I DON'T KNOW!
review: Very little is enticing about Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon Because I DONT KNOW! outside of the license being used and even that isnt applied properly here.

title: Emergency Mayhem
genres: Driving | Racing | Mission-based | Arcade | Mission-based | Automobile
review: Inevitably its the mini-games that really muff things up though.

title: Protothea
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Scrolling | Scrolling | Shoot-'Em-Up | Vertical
review: Impossibly slow 2D shooter whose only worth is to prove what artistry goes into its betters.

title: Psychotoxic
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Such is the nature of a bad game though; if its bad it would have always been and always will be bad.

title: ShellShock 2: Blood Trails
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Third-Person | Historic | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: Zombies in jungle and abandoned temples – that’s a nice setup for a Left 4 Dead campaign. Unfortunately Rebellion is not Valve. Repeatedly press button on-screen to survive torture says a hint message during one of the interactive cutscenes. Oh I wish there was a button to erase Shellshock 2 from my memory.

title: Underground Pool
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: There is nothing good to say about Underground Pool. Everything about it is either frustrating boring or stupid.

title: Freedom: First Resistance
review: Freedoms total lack of action is complemented by a complete absence of adventure leaving only bland graphics and a general sense of tedium to fill the giant void that exists between installing the game and finishing it.

title: Eureka Seven Vol. 2: The New Vision
review: With all of the gameplay here being decidedly sub-par the third volume should just scrap any remnants of gameplay and become one long non-interactive cutscene. Put it onto a DVD and charge fans of the show $10 to get more of their fix but for the love of that is good in gaming just dont make a game out of it.

title: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon Because I DON'T KNOW!
review: Its not entirely without entertainment value – kids will no doubt get a kick out of the license – but its longevity to even the most faithful followers is severely limited. Weve got no time for this adventure.

title: Xiaolin Showdown
review: As a community we must save the children...from mediocre cartoon-based cideogame adaptations like this one! [Holiday 2006 p.76]

title: Painkiller: Hell & Damnation
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Nostalgia is a powerful thing – but in some cases it can be problematic. The industry has certainly moved on from the days when games such as Painkiller: Hell & Damnation were commonplace and while its not unreasonable to look back on these times with fondness that doesnt mean that this lazy rehash deserves your attention. This is a shining example of corner-cutting outdated ideas and in truth is a complete waste of your time.

title: Farming Simulator
review: Appalling textures clunky systems and gameplay you have to shake yourself away from. [Dec 2013 p.95]

title: Escape Dead Island
genres: Action Adventure | Adventure | 3D | Survival | Third-Person | Modern
review: The developer attempts to justify non sequiturs with a psychological narrative that distorts reality but the twists only become more and more meaningless as the escape progresses.

title: Inner Chains
review: The art design is amazing but thats pretty much all that it is. Performance and gameplay issues prevent this game from being something much better.

title: The Warriors: Street Brawl
review: It can be fun but the pacing is annoying and the difficulty will frustrate all but the devoted.

title: Brain Boost: Gamma Wave
review: 505 Game Street has been commercially smart to jump aboard the Brain Training bandwagon quickly but it has made a huge mistake in throwing a faceless copycat effort out there. Hopefully people will not be remotely fooled - were certainly not.

title: MTV Sports: Skateboarding featuring Andy Macdonald
review: Horrible control lousy graphics and a migraine-inducing frame rate all add up to one of the worst games on the market. If you want skateboarding action just stick to Tony Hawk.

title: Zatch Bell! Mamodo Fury
review: If you dont care how broken and rudimentary this game is as long as its like the show youre going to be in a fury in no time.

title: Blood Drive
genres: Simulation | Driving | Racing | General | General | Vehicle | Combat
review: Guns cars and zombies are apparently not enough. The lack of the all important fun factor ruins most of the fun you could have had running down zombies with your fancy muscle cars.

title: Prison Break: The Conspiracy
review: When the only reason youre compelled to continue playing a game is to point and laugh at how badly the entire thing has been thrown together you know that it has major problems.

title: Freestyle Street Soccer
review: Theres also a full set of uninteresting urban ethnic stereotypes rendered in starkly dated graphics and loudmouth fake gangsta sound bites. [Mar 2004 p.85]

title: Dragon Ball Z: Taiketsu
review: There are better fighting games out there for GBA even for hardcore fans of Dragon Ball Z. [Spring 2004 p.40]

title: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse
genres: Action | General | Action Adventure | Fantasy | General | Fantasy
review: Add Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse to the list of licensed games that fail to deliver an experience that challenges entertains and stands apart from its source material.

title: The Golden Compass
review: Even if you were completely charmed by Philip Pullmans work or enjoyed the movie adaptation theres absolutely no reason to give this game a try. Even the music as pretty as it is cant redeem such poor gameplay and atrocious presentation.

title: Scourge: Outbreak
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Only an incurable dependence on third-person shooter will push you to buy this title. Move over. Seriously theres nothing here that can attract your interest.

title: MotionSports
review: With deeply flawed motion controls and a number of other issues MotionSports fumbles all its potential.

title: Looney Tunes: Acme Arsenal
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Fantasy | Platformer | Fantasy | 3D
review: Dull repetitive and carelessly programmed dont even begin to sum up how crummy this action game based on the Looney Tunes license is.

title: Real Steel
review: A prime example of a film-to-game adaptation gone wrong. It perpetuates the stereotype that games based on movies arent good with a missed opportunity to use established mechanics effectively.

title: Soldier Elite
review: Fill your house with treacle and grenades instead. Thats actually more fun. [Sept 2005 p.102]

title: Deep Black: Reloaded
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Arcade
review: With apologies to The Little Mermaid perhaps third-person shooters arent one of those things thats much better down where its wetter under the sea.

title: Battle: Los Angeles
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: A lifeless carcass in the FPS mould lies in its wake. [Issue#109 p.104]

title: Montague's Mount
review: I was expecting (and hoping for) a spooky and atmospheric thrill ride but instead got an ill conceived and unpolished first person puzzle game. The story is weak the puzzles unintuitive and the experience wholly unsatisfying. Explorers would be better served travelling back in time and playing Myst or picking up one of the games I mentioned above. Steer clear of this one.

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: As I painfully maneuvered my Charlie from room to room I grew more and more desperate in my attempt to find redeeming qualities in the game.

title: SuperPower
review: The games lack of focus poor design and beta-like release state will put it not in the forefront of strategy discussion boards but rather the back of discount software bins.

title: The Cursed Crusade
review: A game broken in so many ways even its budget price tag is not enough to save it from oblivion.

title: Ultimate Beach Soccer
review: One begins to wonder where the company found the nerve to release a game that plays as if it were coded by the ultimate beach personality Jeff Spiccoli. [Mar 2004 p.80]

title: Torino 2006 - the Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
review: This official game of the Games however makes it about as exciting as lying in an empty bath and pretending its the luge or sticking your head in the freezer and singing Advance Australia Fair.

title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
review: It borrows so heavily from the format of Marvel Ultimate Alliance that you’ll likely be hard pressed to find anyone who won’t tell you to simply play that game instead. Considering all the bad movie games we’ve seen in the past year saying that this is one of the worst should really mean something.

title: Drive Girls
review: Drive Girls is a hack and slash slog where you quite literally drive girls who transform into cars to fight evil bugs. It is every bit the stupid ridiculous freaky fun game that it sounds like and has some guilty pleasure elements that can endear it to players even while they recognize it is a total wreck. Battles are unique but ultimately boring and a bad story and lackluster look makes Drive Girls a mostly forgettable mess.

title: Air Raid: This Is Not a Drill!
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic
review: This is the style of arcade game that was around in mechanical form since the early 50s. Its just an on-rails shooter that never lets up. You never move from your position while shooting down swarms of Japanese aircraft with your AA gun. Its so easy to play its ridiculous.

title: Army Men: Green Rogue
review: A game that can only generate slight indifference.

title: Turning Point: Fall of Liberty
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Historic | Historic | Arcade
review: With the number of average-to-outstanding FPS titles available on next-gen consoles there’s absolutely no reason to waste your time with this disaster. [Apr 2008 p.86]

title: 25 to Life
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: A sentence of 25 to Life lasts only six to seven hours if played on medium difficulty. [Apr 2006 p.51]

title: Pocket Racers
review: Online minigames and a decent selection of cars don’t save Pocket Racers from being one of the worst rubber-burners on Sony’s portable system.

title: Doctor Who: The Eternity Clock
review: Its frustrating. More so because the easy bits are so repetitive and simple while the tricky bits are random and insane.

title: Wacky Races: Crash & Dash
genres: Driving | Racing | Arcade | Kart | Other | Kart
review: While everything basically works as it should steering is still made difficult by a mixture of poor camera angles and claustrophobic tracks.

title: Troll and I
review: Slapping down poor video games never brings me much pleasure especially those that genuinely show promise. While it has a unique setting and some solid ideas boring level design and a general lack of imagination when piecing together all of these components leaves me with very little to praise.

title: Senran Kagura Reflexions
review: Senran Kagura Reflexions has actually done a lot of damage to the series.

title: RollerCoaster Tycoon 3D
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: Havent we all once loved RollerCoaster Tycoon? We too were all cheery and happy when we heard about a new 3DS version of the game. RollerCoaster Tycoon 3D proved to be a bummer though not good at all. Say goodbye to your dreams.

title: Brain Boost: Beta Wave
review: While Brain Training still clearly continues to rule the brain-boosting roost there is no reason why a few more decent mental agility games shouldnt come along to challenge its title.

title: The Polar Express
review: It has so many flaws combined with the short span of the game makes for one that would be near impossible to recommend.

title: Family Guy: Back to the Multiverse
genres: Action | General | Action Adventure | Fantasy | General | Fantasy
review: Appalling levels terrible writing repetitive gags and weak shooting mechanics make for one of the least enjoyable experiences of 2012. Be smart and avoid at all costs. [Issue#93 p.82]

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
review: Atrocious. And not atrociously good fun either. Simply atrocious. Its like biting into an Oh Henry and discovering that it is indeed a big fat solid chunk of stanky human dung and undigested peanuts.

title: 25 to Life
review: The single player is boring arrestingly conventional and entirely forgettable. The multiplayer is slightly better though mostly because of its options and not because of its gameplay.

title: Hello Neighbor
review: Hello Neighbor could be fun within the right parameters. The neighbour would hold a lot more terror if his actions carried any weight. The puzzling aspect of switches hidden doors and traps would be more enjoyable were they staged within an inspiring world or using interesting concepts. But the game fails on all of these points not holding attention not really projecting any fear beyond the first few encounters and the world feels as flat as the polygons used to build it.

title: Coffeetime Crosswords
genres: Miscellaneous | Puzzle | Puzzle | General | Puzzle | Logic | General
review: Insultingly simple and clumsy Live Arcade puzzle game unworthy of your time.

title: Ju-on: The Grudge
review: Theres simply not enough material here to justify the asking price and the small amount on the disc is sub-par entertainment on almost every level. [Dec 2009 p.111]

title: Thor: God of Thunder
review: Thor: God of Thunder looks terrible plays poorly and was obviously rushed out to market with no fine-tuning whatsoever. Considering that the DS version is so much better by comparison (along with the vastly superior free Flash title from Marvel Studios) Im saddened that this game had to ever exist.

title: R.I.P.D. The Game
genres: Action | General | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: R.I.P.D.: The Game is really nothing more than a crappy movie tie-in game in the longstanding tradition of crappy movie tie-in games. There’s not much substance here and what you do get is so unpolished and unrewarding that it’s not worth your time.

title: Raven Squad: Operation Hidden Dagger
review: Raven Squad is 90 percent first-person shooter 10 percent strategy game and 100 percent bad.

title: Monsters Inc. Scream Arena
review: This is not a game for Disney fans kids or anyone. In fact its barely a game at all.

title: Anacapri: The Dream
review: Anacapri has more in common with the ancient gameplay of early 90s adventures than anything modern but even as a pseudo-nostalgia piece its no fun at all.

title: Onechanbara: Bikini Samurai Squad
review: Just save your money and play something that is actually worth your time.

title: Tony Hawk's Motion
genres: Sports | Alternative | Individual | Skateboarding | Skateboarding | Skate / Skateboard
review: A poorly produced game with little to offer any Tony Hawk fan.

title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
review: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor has all the right elements yet it still manages to do everything wrong.

title: Cartoon Network Racing
review: I was completely disappointed. It tries to be exactly like Mario Kart but it doesn’t even come close to that level of enjoyment. This genre does not need any more lame imitators. It needs innovators.

title: The Deer God
review: The blurb for The Deer God promises to Challenge your religion and your platforming skills but it does neither. The platforming moments are ridiculously easy and the combat is easily abused. The worst of the game though is the story which constantly stresses a morality that makes no sense at all all culminating in an absolutely moronic ending. There are many fantastic indie titles that have made the jump to Nindies. This is not one of them.

title: Coffee Tycoon
review: If Coffee Tycoon were a beverage it would taste worse than cold coffee with a shot of urine in it. Try Lemonade Tycoon 2: New York Edition for a much more pleasant beverage-tycoon gaming experience.

title: Universal Studios Theme Parks Adventure
review: Too frustrating and convoluted for kids to have any fun with it and all but the most desperate adult GameCube fans will find it tedious and unentertaining as well.

title: Resident Evil: Survivor
review: Itll provide you with about four hours maximum of campy brainless shooting kicks. Just dont blame me for feeling dirty afterward because you will oh yes you will.

title: Realms of Ancient War
review: One step away from a total disaster. And that step - lots of enemies - isnt very interesting.

title: Inkheart
review: The one saving grace that the game does has is that is references plenty of older classic novels that young kids may have never heard of.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5
review: One of gamings greatest series bails horribly loses its high score and sinks to a depressing new low. Truly awful.

title: Turn It Around
review: Id like to recommend the game in some fashion but sadly it took longer to pen this piece than it did for me to get through the actual game with one notable exception - no wrist pain.

title: Pacific Rim
review: Guillermo del Toro once said in an interview he made the film for himself and his children and it shows. The game on the other hand might just be the perfect instrument to penalize adolescent troublemakers.

title: Alone in the Dark
review: Alone In The Dark is a truly shining example of both how to make a bad game and how to over-hype a game. Avoid.

title: Star Wars: Flight of the Falcon
review: A neck-stabbingly frustrating bore. [Apr 2004 p.86]

title: Putty Squad
review: Ugly is not enough to define Putty Squad. It is simply an (almost) unpublished game from 20 years ago with outdated graphics and gameplay.

title: Motocross Mania 3
review: Wiping your memory clean of Motocross Mania 3 is one of the best things you could do as it is a perfect example of how to not make a game correctly.

title: Burnout Legends
review: Then we come to the control which is also shot up quite horrendously. The vehicular turning is pretty lofty at best where you have to maintain an incredible sense of steering. This combined with the so-called tactics for scoring takedowns on opponent vehicles just leads to remarkably bad frustration.

title: Dead or Alive Paradise
review: Avoid at all costs. Playability is awful and even the girls arent that sexy: they are destroyed by low polygon count models and horrible textures.

title: Battleship
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Board Games | Shooter | Board Games | First-Person | Tactical
review: Extremely unsuccessful attempt to create a cool shooter can possibly attract gamers only for its easily obtainable achievements. [June 2012]

title: Battle: Los Angeles
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: Battle: Los Angeles looks plays and entertains as some Uwe Boll of game word took it and created it with the support of an enthusiastic circle of amateur programmers. [Issue#203]

title: Attack of the Movies 3D
review: Attack of the Movies 3-D is one of the worst games I’ve played in a long time.

title: Painkiller: Resurrection
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Painkiller: Resurrection is a bugfest. It is technically outdated and the co-op mode is hidden between the menus. There is no way to make this multiplayer mode work well.

title: Umbrella Corps
review: Theres little satisfaction in downing an enemy who cant see you less in getting flattened by an unseen assailant. [Issue#296 p.114]

title: G.I. Combat
review: The nonexistent tutorial clunky interface rough and bland graphics and quirky AI are all hallmarks of a game released too early... more an exercise in frustration and bewilderment than a game.

title: Driven
review: Just stay away from Driven for the love of God stay away.

title: Pimp My Ride
review: Some subjects will just never translate well into videogames--like anything related to proctology Paris Hilton or yes MTV shows. [Feb. 2007 p.79]

title: Godzilla Unleashed
review: Godzilla Unleashed is a latter-generation PS2 title arriving just in time for Christmas - it doesnt play well it doesnt look good and it doesnt offer anything new.

title: DARK
genres: Action Adventure | Modern | General | Modern | Linear
review: Realmforge is clearly a student of the genre but budget is king here and the studio lacks the financial clout to even pierce the flesh of a crowded market. Despite being crafted with noble intentions Dark succeeds only in sucking the life out of itself.

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: What’s frustrating is that Terminal Reality whether you believe it or not had laid the foundations for an extraordinary game. WD:SI includes all the activities that a decent zombie survival game should have. [May 2013]

title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows
review: How can such a bad game be part of the Summer of Arcade? Those games need to be special. This Turtles game is definitely not.

title: Naruto Shippuden: Dragon Blade Chronicles
review: Its not that Naruto Shippuden: Dragon Blade Chronicles is completely broken its just that each and every aspect of it is so flawed that it results in an experience that is mediocre at best.

title: Vampire Rain
review: Even a game with a bad story can be salvageable if the gameplay is fun. Unfortunately this isn’t the case.

title: Thor: God of Thunder
review: Thor: God of Thunder is what one would come to expect with other movie-licensed games. The cinematics are sub-par the combo system is quite repetitive and the difficulty is skewed. The only redeeming qualities I found were using the leveling system to actually refill your health and Odin Force and the effects of the elemental attacks looked cool but the fun factor is just not there.

title: Project Root
review: Theres scope here for a good game were a bit more work put in but the smart money says that youll be way more frustrated with Project Roots patently unfair gameplay than you are impressed by it.

title: Carnival Games: Mini-Golf
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Golf | Arcade | Arcade
review: While the graphics and hole designs are inviting the frustrations caused by the controls and Barker himself successfully put a damper on the entire experience.

title: Raven Squad: Operation Hidden Dagger
review: Youd be a Raven lunatic to buy it. [Oct 2009 p.90]

title: Seven Kingdoms: Conquest
review: This is an even worse game than Empire Earth 3 for the simple fact that the design shows promise but its utterly undermined by the horrible execution.

title: Kengo: Legend of the 9
review: Who knew that samurai swordfighting could ever be so dull and annoying?

title: The Simpsons Skateboarding
review: If you’re looking for Tony Hawk Pro Skater for a much younger crowd or really love the show Simpsons Skateboarding will surely disappoint.

title: Blades of Time
review: Re-playing Blades of Time in 2019 is surreal. There are assuredly many better games from the previous generation of consoles that deserve to be on Switch ahead of this one. I can’t even imagine the developers have any hope of using this re-release to springboard the franchise back as they work on a sequel because no one is going to want a sequel after playing it. Time hasn’t been good to Blades of Time and and other than for the morbidly curious I can’t see anyone being masochistic enough to derive any value out of it.

title: Rock Revolution
review: More revolting than it is a revolution. [May 2009 p.87]

title: Legend of the Dragon
review: Legend of the Dragon is a disappointment for a fighting game. There is a general lack of anything that stands out to make it worth paying attention to or purchasing.

title: Heavy Fire: Red Shadow
review: Heavy Fire: Red Shadow is short and for once in a linear game that’s a good thing because I wanted to move on with my life the second I had finished playing it. Casually prejudiced generic in nearly every way and an absolute bore to slog through it genuinely might be the worst game on PlayStation VR. If you’re given this as a gift cut out that person from your life even if they’re a blood relative. It isn’t worth it.

title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
review: T3s first-person shooting stages are plagued by poor controls terrible level designs brain-dead enemies and just plain ugly graphics. [Feb 2004 p.106]

title: SoulCalibur: Lost Swords
review: To call Lost Swords a failed experiment would be an insult to every ambitious game that fell flat on its face. It feels like Namco put barely any thought into making the not-so-micro-transactions justifiable or even making sure that the single-player focus felt consistently engaging.

title: Dying: Reborn
review: Dying: Reborn is an interesting enough puzzle game that falls short of making any kind of impact at all. A cash-in game for the VR age skipping this title would be recommended.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Harry Potter turns into a wannabe third person shooter and the result is abysmal. Movie-based games get a bad rap and its because of titles like this one. We cant think of anything nice to say about it not even when playing it with Kinect. Its a bad game from end to end and has no redeeming qualities. Avoid at all cost even if (or maybe especially if) youre a Harry Potter-head.

title: Hello Neighbor
review: The concept for the game is great level design is solid and the visuals are sometimes nice but the whole thing is painfully underdone. [02/2018 p.46]

title: Looney Tunes: Acme Arsenal
review: Dull repetitive and carelessly programmed dont even begin to sum up how crummy this action game based on the Looney Tunes license is.

title: ECW Anarchy Rulz
review: Its as tired and useless as many of the wrestlers represented and playing this is almost like watching a seniors match in wrestling -- old familiar faces doing the same old familiar moves that made them famous.

title: Left Behind: Eternal Forces
review: Avoid this title like the plague. Not only are you sparing yourself the discomfort of ham-fisted preaching and shoddy game mechanics you’ll also be doing your part to ensure that this obscene mess of eschatological flotsam and apocryphal jetsam never sees a sequel.

title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
review: Sierra couldnt have picked a more forgettable swan song than an adaptation of the latest iteration in the blandly epic Mummy franchise thats as dull to look at as it is to play.

title: Evolution Snowboarding
review: Save for a few boss designs the graphics are dull while the arcade-styled controls are so simple as to almost reward a lack of skill. [Feb 2003 p.33]

title: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones
review: Overall wed prefer death to torture and perhaps both to an extended session playing this game. [Winter 2002 p.47]

title: The Ripping Friends
review: Without nearly enough sight gags or over-the-top style to actually put that humor in the game its kind of pointless.

title: Steel Battalion: Heavy Armor
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Vehicle | Mech | Mech | Combat
review: This motion never works consistently and the controller itself (which the game says you need to hold as both movement and firing are done from it) even blocks your hands from the sensor sometimes. This basically means that in the heat of battle youre putting your hands in front of you back and forth constantly just to see/shoot/move and go back to view your instruments.

title: Godzilla
review: Bumbling combat laughable visuals and terribly overpriced.

title: Bubble Bobble Revolution
review: Unfortunately nostalgia rarely holds up they couldnt even implement the new systems features and instead of taking something old and reinventing it they made a broken version of a classic game with graphics that have no character.

title: Pure Futbol
genres: Sports | Traditional | Team | Soccer | Sim | Arcade | Arcade
review: FIFA Street meets Mario Strikers but even as an arcade game this falls well short of world class.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 1
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: It doesnt matter if youre a hardcore or casual fan: theres no magic to be seen here.

title: Far Cry Vengeance
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: One of the Wiis worst games an underdeveloped mess that will turn off most of its players by the middle – or possibly even the beginning -- of level one. Ubisoft attempted some innovative control techniques but most of them feel awful-- even doing simple things like jumping and lobbing grenades sucks.

title: Touhou Kobuto V: Burst Battle
review: Touhou Kobuto V: Burst Battle is the worst Touhou game I’ve played and one that you should avoid unless you absolutely must own everything Touhou.

title: Randall
review: This is the freshman effort for developer We the Force Studios and it is certainly noticeable throughout the entirety of Randall. The Mexico based developer has crafted a game that obviously pays homage to a style of gameplay that they are fond of. However the end result is little more than just that: an homage without any of the hooks that make other games of this variety so great. There is certainly potential for a great game within Randall and I hope this fledgling developer is able to learn from its mistakes to craft a more cohesive game in its next attempt.

title: Tenchu: Dark Secret
review: A botched excuse for a stealth game whose only achievement is bringing a decent series name into disrepute. This game should have been so much better. [Jan 2007 p.72]

title: Napoleon Dynamite: The Game
genres: Action | Miscellaneous | Puzzle | General | General | Puzzle | Party / Minigame | General
review: The core problem with Napoleon Dynamite: The Game is that it totally disregards the humor of the film (and as such of the audience its attempting to reach). The whole joke of Napoleon Dynamite was that Jon Heders titular character constantly claims to have more skill than he actually possesses. In the game you have all that skill and more.

title: Torino 2006 - The Official Video Game of the XX Olympic Winter Games
genres: Sports | Olympic Sports | Olympic Sports | Individual | Athletics
review: This official game of the Games however makes it about as exciting as lying in an empty bath and pretending its the luge or sticking your head in the freezer and singing Advance Australia Fair.

title: Pocket Pool
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: Pocket Pool largely fails as a billiards simulation and completely fails as a source of titillation. Go to the local pool hall and talk to some flesh and blood women instead.

title: Speed Zone
review: Had the handling and collision detection been improved then Wheelspin might actually have been a good game. [Issue#91 p.114]

title: TMNT
review: A rushed production that regrettably yet predictably emerges as a substandard game of a substandard film.

title: Aqua Teen Hunger Force Zombie Ninja Pro-Am
review: Just because a game seemingly aims to be bad on purpose doesnt make it any less of a bad game.

title: Shifters
review: The game really doesnt offer anything interesting aside from the whole shape-shifting thing which is does poorly. With empty battles and bland side-quests the point of it all is lost.

title: Legend of the Dragon
review: Throughout its lifespan Legend of the Dragon fails to entertain for more than a few minutes.

title: Quantum Theory

review: Awful - a crushing disappointment. [Oct 2010 p.102]

review: It could have been an interesting title but the problems with control weird gameplay style terrible graphics and rigged repetitive games just kill any joy that would be garnered from playing it.

title: Gauntlet: Dark Legacy
review: The biggest issue players will likely have is fighting off sheer boredom instead of a pack of orcs trolls or scorpions.

title: Hour of Victory

review: If the single-player campaign isn’t painful enough Hour of Victory offers a multiplayer component so poorly constructed that just trying to shoot another person makes you feel as stupid and incompetent as the game’s AI. title: Blackwater
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: This is a bad game from top to bottom and it doesnt deserve a moment of your attention.

title: NFL Blitz 20-02

title: Left Alive
review: With so many narrative technical and gameplay issues that pop up at almost every turn — all wound up within some of the worst third-person stealth mechanics imaginable — Left Alive is both a horridly-conceived experience and a fundamentally unenjoyable product to even attempt to immerse one’s self in.

title: Defender
review: Defender proves that more is not necessarily better especially when it comes to modes of play. Rather than take a rock solid format and enhance it through multiple variants of the same basic theme the developers have created a mess and tried to cover it up with different versions that all have weaknesses.

title: Rocky and Bullwinkle
review: Zany but this price is just ridiculous. [June 2008 p.79]

title: Underworld Ascendant
review: Underworld Ascendant is a buggy repetitive and boring mess of an RPG.

title: Wonder World Amusement Park
review: Wonderworld Amusement Park has no personality; no soul. Theres nothing on offer here that other Wii mini-game collections havent already beaten to death. Whats worse many of these games are frustrating or have unresponsive controls.

title: Ready 2 Rumble Revolution
genres: Sports | Traditional | Individual | Boxing | Boxing | Combat | Boxing / Martial Arts
review: Basically Ready 2 Rumble Revolution for the Wii is nearly unplayable. I love the idea of having an arcade boxer on the Wii and while boxing on Wii Sports didnt exactly blow my socks off it worked out far better than this game did. Im not sure that complicated controls for an arcade boxer are the way to go on the Wii and Ready 2 Rumble proves that more punch types dont necessarily translate into a better boxing experience.

title: Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing
review: It doesn’t seem to know whether it wants to be a realistic simulation of the sport or a straight-out arcade game as it stands it manages to succeed as neither.

title: Crystal Rift
review: Crystal Rift possesses all the potential in the world and I certainly hope the game performs well enough that the development team is able to go back to the drawing board and come up with a more comprehensive and nuanced structure for another crack at the VR dungeon crawler.

title: Traitors Gate 2
review: Virtually unplayable.

title: Frogger 2

title: Escape from Bug Island

title: Tamagotchi Party On!

title: 3D Classics: Urban Champion
review: Skip over 3D Classics: Urban Champion. Urban Champion is not a classic it never was and 3D is entirely wasted on it.

title: Lucha Fury
review: Very inspired by the Lucha Libre comic Lucha Fury offers a really polished artistic direction colorful visuals and a fun mexican wrestling take on the atmosphere. But once you get your hands on the controller it feels like youve been suplexed hard : the gameplay clearly lacks smoothness the characters feel like theyre ice skating all the time collision bugs are legion and theres latency in the execution of the combat moves... The special moves seem dull and there arent any enemy really fun to battle. Levels are repetitive poorly paced musics can make you crazy... its the typical example of a beatem all with a world and atmosphere that would have been perfect for the genre if only the gameplay wasnt a real mess.

title: Fluster Cluck
review: If I was to walk up to someone and ask Have you played Fluster Cluck? I’d probably get the strange eye which pretty much sums up my thoughts on the game as a whole.

review: Chances are youll have more fun reading a medical textbook. [August 2002 p.69]

title: Past Cure
review: A joyless chore. [Apr 2018 p.84]

title: Orion: Dino Horde
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Arcade

review: The only real change-up in the whole game is when the Turtles get shiny cybernetic-looking gear when they travel into the future. Its literally wave after wave of enemies through eight stages that serve as mere backdrops. And that wasnt really what was worth remembering from the old days.

title: Hollow

review: The graphics are bland the sound is grating and the gameplay is about as much fun as watching paint dry. There are better things you could do with twenty dollars.
