review: Umbrella Corps is the most expensive free-to-play that you will find in the market. Not only is its gameplay terrible but its online mode does not feature anybody to play with so the game is almost dead by now. Capcom made us cry.

title: Risen 3: Titan Lords
review: Though Risen 3 has its moments there is simply too much to overlook even if you’re patient enough to make it five or six hours into the game. Role-playing die hards may be able to wring a few morsels of enjoyment from Titan Lords though others including casual fans of the genres will find it almost unplayable.

title: Double D Dodgeball
genres: Action | Sports | General | General | Team | Other
review: With the hefty $10.00 price tag for Double D Dodgeball all gamers alike should dodge this title (no pun intended).

title: Arc of Alchemist
review: Poor performance is bad enough but let me put it as simply as possible - the port in this state should not have been allowed to release. Its an embarrassment and Idea Factory clearly knew what a stinker the game was with the haphazard axing of the games originally planned English dub and NA physical releases. Arc of Alchemist is the worst game that I have ever reviewed and I sincerely hope that Idea Factory takes the time to really consider how this game came out the way that it did. I know they can do better than this.

title: Fight Club
review: The first rule of Fight Club is: you do not talk about Fight Club. [Jan. 05]

title: Eternity: The Last Unicorn
review: If it means having to play Eternity to save them youre better off letting that last Unicorn go extinct.

title: Tokyo Tattoo Girls
review: In the end what we have in Tokyo Tattoo Girls is by far one of the most shallow strategy games Ive ever seen with absolutely a joke of a story and shallow and repetitive gameplay. Its just so utterly disappointing in just about every aspect. As someone who doesnt have any tattoos (although my wife more than makes up for me) I think Id rather go get my first one than play this game any more than I had to.

title: One Piece: Grand Cruise
review: One Piece: Grand Cruise is an awful experience that lacks both in content and quality.

title: Infernal: Hell's Vengeance
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Fantasy | Fantasy | Arcade
review: Something like Infernal: Hells Vengeance might have gained a minor following during the last generation (and thats a big might have) but it simply doesnt have any place in todays environment. review: It has a great idea in terms of graphical presentation and plotline but it throws it all away through poor gameplay design.

title: Bad Boys: Miami Takedown
review: It isn’t the worst game ever made but that just means that it fails to achieve distinction even by its badness.

title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
review: I can sum it up with one word: sloppy.

review: If you need a comic-book movie-license game fix look elsewhere. I beg you. [Aug 2007 p.83]

review: A truly incomprehensible final product. title: NCIS

review: As Valhalla Knights moves to the Wii any potential for fun is buried under tons of repetitive busywork and technical gaffs.

title: Super Seducer: How to Talk to Girls
review: Super Seducer: How to Talk to Women is too stupid to be sexist. It’s a relic from the Entourage era we’re all better off having moved on from and absolutely nothing to get worked up over.

title: Fugitive Hunter: War on Terror
review: It just isnt any good. With so many gameplay problems lack of challenges and an absolute treaure trove of better FPS titles out there for PS2 theres no reason to give this one a second thought. [Jan 2004 p.46]

review: Langrisser Re:Incarnation -Tensei- seems decent based on pictures or perhaps a short on paper explanation but it quickly becomes apparent how rushed development must have been.

review: Be warned...You Are Empty isnt so much a title as a disclaimer. [Mar 2008 p.74]

review: Its never fun to play a game thats so fundamentally uninteresting that you really struggle to even watch the screen as youre playing.

title: The Shield: The Game
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Third-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: One of the most boring generic games out there even with a strong character like Vic Mackey. Theres really nothing about the gameplay visuals sound or story that can justify a purchase.

title: Girl Fight
review: Girl Fight is simply one of the worst fighting games out there. In a world where you can buy Virtua Fighter 5 Final Showdown with just a few euros nobody should ever think about downloading this crappy clone of Tecmos Dead or Alive.

title: McFarlane's Evil Prophecy
review: The game is a total disaster with no redeeming qualities. Konami has taken an interesting license and thrown away all potential.

title: Chicago Enforcer
review: A terrible game. If for some reason you actually decide to go and pay $20 for this very poor excuse of a first person shooter then expect to find: a weak and very uninteresting story the absolute worst gameplay ever on the Xbox repetitive textures and bland colors and a very poor sound scheme.

title: Shrek: Super Party
review: Do not pass go head directly to jail. Its bad. Boring. And also bad.

title: AMY
review: Amy makes us understand parents who hit their children and that statement on itself is scarier than the hours we wasted playing this piece of crap.

title: Kick-Ass
review: The only asses that need kicking in this game are those of the developer responsible for such rubbish.

title: Superman Returns
genres: Action | Action Adventure | Beat-'Em-Up | Beat-'Em-Up | Open-World | 2D
review: The mini missions are klunky beyond belief with extremely shoddy animation and they almost always have to be completed in a stupidly short length of time for enjoyment - and thats it. Ideal for morons with low expectations. [Feb 2007 p.82]

title: The Incredible Hulk
review: The Incredible Hulk: The Official Videogame is simply one of the worst super-hero tie-ins of all time.

title: Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing
review: An all around mess of a game Mike Tyson Heavyweight Boxing is officially one of (if not THE) worst examples of digital boxing weve ever seen.

title: Farming Simulator
review: Overall Farming Simulator does not feel like a simulator – if the point of the game is to offer a realistic experience of what it’s like to run a farm the game fails: people never fatigue (your staff will work straight through the 24-clock if left unattended) livestock produce is harvested by AI automatically and there’s a few game-breaking exploits that completely undermine the game.

title: X Rebirth
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Space | Large Spaceship | Large Spaceship | Civilian
review: Patches may stop the glitches but I think this space sim is far beyond repair.

title: Dawn of Fear
review: Nostalgia always works right? All the drama and all the emotions hit the right spot in the brain and suddenly you are in love with something. Dawn of Fear is here to prove this theory wrong. It seem that the only thing the developers worked on was the nostalgia aspect and nothing else. Quite simply stay away from this game.

title: Van Helsing
review: It’s obviously slapped together for a quick buck but it isn’t worth yours. With poor gameplay and underpar production values you won’t be seeing this title praised by anyone.

title: Yu Yu Hakusho: Spirit Detective
review: Its pure boredom harnessed in cartridge form. [Feb 2004 p.128]

title: Demonworld: Dark Armies
review: What really condemns Demonworld though are its atrocious graphics and horrific AI and pathfinding. [Apr 2002 p.73]

title: Dragon Booster
review: Dragon Booster is a halfhearted and practically unplayable racing game with no redeeming qualities.

title: Call of Duty: Black Ops Declassified
genres: Shooter | Modern | Action | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Arcade
review: The single player campaign of Declassified is barely worth mentioning; within one hour youve seen it all. The multiplayer doesnt keep you interested for much longer. Its light on maps and modes but more importantly it misses action. Black Ops Declassified makes us miss the time of the UMD when a sub-par game could at least be used as a fancy coaster.

title: Mistmare
review: More punishment than game. No matter what the box says this isnt so much a fantasy role-playing game as it is a medieval torture device right up there with the rack and the iron maiden.

title: Mortal Kombat Advance
review: It doesnt help that the AI is ludicrously tough and as cheap as possible. The AI can pull off moves that the gamer couldnt possibly do as fast.

title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Crossfire
genres: Simulation | Sci-Fi | Vehicle | Mech | Mech | Combat
review: Avoid this title like a 12th century leper. It’s easily the worst game of the launch the worst giant robot game ever and front runner for worst anime-inspired game in history.

title: Megamind: Ultimate Showdown
review: The epitome of a terrible movie tie-in game.

title: Target: Terror
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | Light Gun | Light Gun
review: Only pick this up if youre the sort of person who buys supermarket own-brand bog roll and enjoys the rough sawdust texture.

title: Iron Man
review: Combat though is miserable. [Aug 2008 p.73]

title: Bruce Lee: Quest of the Dragon
review: The twin albatrosses of slowdown and mediocre graphics loom large over Dragon and shoddy programming allows for honest-to-dreadfulness crashes. [Fall 2002 p.118]

title: Rekoil
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Modern | Arcade
review: Rekoil suffers from game-breaking glitches that range from aggravating to completely bewildering.

title: Zombeer
review: Zombeer is an utter disaster plain & simple. Dont buy it even if you are the best zombie fan out there.

title: Women's Volleyball Championship
review: It is a great thing to bring light to an under promoted sport such as womens volleyball but in this case its like Ronald McDonald promoting P.E.T.A. It doesnt really help. So whatever you do DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

title: MTV's Celebrity Deathmatch
review: Celebrity Deathmatchs biggest problem isnt its timing but rather its the absolutely horrid gameplay and complete lack of any worthwhile features.

title: Weeping Doll
review: Weeping Doll is a brief presentation of experiments that do not work in virtual reality. Its theme is neither frightening nor coherent its puzzles are mundane and straightforward player movement is disorienting and inelegant and its visual aesthetic imitates the vision of a person with a dangerous blood alcohol concentration. Weeping Doll blunders its format worse than Digital Pictures full-motion video projects miscalculated the Sega CD.

title: Land of the Dead: Road to Fiddler's Green
review: Land of the Dead fails to deliver even the most garden-variety of zombie-killing thrills due to its inept combat awful visuals and cripplingly stupid artificial intelligence.

title: Escape Dead Island
genres: Action Adventure | Adventure | 3D | Survival | Third-Person | Modern
review: A poor entry into a solid series that doesnt try to improve the experience or come up with any new ideas. Stick with the past and wait for the future. [Issue#119 p.85]

title: Sonic Boom: Rise of Lyric
review: I might even consider it the worst Sonic game I have ever played.

title: Gene Rain
review: If Gene Rain ever goes on sale for $5 and you’re desperate for some achievements then by by all means pick it for the points. Otherwise there is no redeeming value in paying anything for the game. There are no strong aspects. Literally nothing is done well. I wish I could say despite all the negatives but I can’t. Gene Rain is just awful and you should save your time and money.

title: Giana Sisters: Dream Runners
review: Giana Sisters: Dream Runners is far too fast frenetic and convoluted for its own good. Run away from this one before it entices you to spend any money.

title: Best of Tests DS
review: The real test of intelligence here is whether or not you are smart enough to avoid this game.

title: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Sci-Fi | Sci-Fi | Arcade
review: The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct is an abomination on every level: a dull cynical and irreparably flawed mess which is as mindless and soulless as its antagonists.

title: New World Order
genres: Action | Shooter | Shooter | First-Person | Modern | Tactical | Modern | Arcade
review: With 12 missions of choppy impossible to play through graphics enemy AI which is apparently psychic and sound that is just plain bad New World Order isnt a game you want in your library... or home... or state.

title: The Expendables 2 Videogame
genres: Action | General | Shooter | Third-Person | Shoot-'Em-Up | Modern | Top-Down
review: Its often difficult to tell where your characters bullets are heading and sometimes tough to see if environmental elements are being affected by your gunfire both of which are vital in a shooter.

title: Jenga World Tour
review: Jenga is here just to fill the gap with no attention to quality whatsoever only to make a quick buck at the expense of distracted fans.

title: Fighters Uncaged
review: To make matters worse you get sent back to a tedious menu screen every single time you learn one of the hundreds of thousands of stupid moves.

title: Dave Mirra BMX Challenge
review: A terrible racing game and its an even worse competition game. You might as well save yourself some cash and just stab yourself in the eye.

title: Coliseum
review: A text-based gladiator management sim Coliseum asks the question How long can you last? The correct answer is: Long enough to get a real wicked #%*!-ing headache.

title: Kabuki Warriors
review: A miserable experience. [Jan 2002 p.96]

title: Pool Party
genres: Sports | Miscellaneous | Parlor | Individual | Billiards | Billiards
review: It was a game no-one noticed because no-one should notice this. Ever. Dont bother looking at it never mind buying or renting it.

title: Magus
review: Magus is not an entertaining game. It suffers from repetitive gameplay bugs glitches and abhorrent visuals. Worse still it’s expensive with the release currently commanding a laughable $24.99 price point on the PlayStation Store. Put your time and money towards something better than this.

title: Ghostbusters
review: Stay away from this game even for a cheap buck. Who ya gonna call? Hopefully the store where this game was purchased from in hopes of asking for a refund.

title: The Simpsons Wrestling
review: A full point goes to the voice cast. Otherwise we wouldn’t use the disc for a Duff beer coaster.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5
review: This Hawk has had its wings clipped to the point where it resembles an ugly-looking flightless dodo that deserves its own extinction. [Christmas 2015 p74]

title: Toy Shop
genres: Strategy | Tycoon | Management | Tycoon | Business / Tycoon
review: The characters models are ugly despite aspiring towards cuteness and the soundtrack will turn your brain into oatmeal.

title: The Asskickers
review: Quality assurance is a beautiful thing people. It keeps sprites on the screen weapons able to be picked up when available always and everything working as they should. I dont know if all was alright in Windows but playing on a Mac… well dont bother.
